intro: Symplocos sousae, commonly known as the African snowberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically white or pale yellow when mature. Symplocos sousae thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems in which it is found.
